{{Redirect|Blocked|the game mechanic that prevents an attack from taking effect|Blocking}}
{{Exclusive|java}}

These commands control a [[Server|server's]] banlist, or blacklist. A blacklist is a list of players or IP addresses that are not allowed to connect to the server. Bans supersede any whitelisting in place.

== ban ==
{{Infobox command
|name=ban
|oplevel=3
|serveronly=y
}}

Adds the player profile(s) into the server blacklist, which prevents anyone from connecting to the server with uuids of these profiles.

=== Syntax ===
:<code>ban <targets> [<reason>]</code>

=== Arguments ===
{{argument|targets|game_profile}}
: Specifies the player profile(s) to be added to the blacklist.
: {{arg desc|je=game_profile}}

{{argument|reason|message}}
: Message to display to the banned player, to other [[operator]]s, and in the server logs.  If unspecified, defaults to <code>Banned by an operator.</code>
: {{arg desc|je=message}}

=== Result ===
{{Result table|onlyje=1}}
{{Result table|The command is incomplete, or any argument is not specified correctly.|unparseable}}
{{Result table|The target selector fails to resolve to one or more online players.|fail}}
{{Result table|Does not add any new player profile to blacklist.}}
{{Result table|succeed}}
{{Result table}}

=== Output ===
{{Output table}}
{{Output table|edition=je|On fail|N/A|0|0}}
{{Output table|On success|N/A|1|the number of new player names added to blacklist.}}
{{Output table}}

== ban-ip ==
{{Infobox command
|name=ban-ip
|oplevel=3
|serveronly=y
}}

Adds an IP address to the blacklist. Adds the narrowly-specified address or address of the named online player into the server blacklist, preventing anyone from connecting to the server from that address.

=== Syntax ===
:<code>ban-ip <target> [<reason>]</code>

=== Arguments ===
{{argument|targets|string}}
: Specifies the IP address to be added to the blacklist. Can also be a name of an online player, which represents the IP of that player.
: {{arg desc|je=string|type=word}}

{{argument|reason|message}}
: Message to display to the banned player, to other [[operator]]s, and in the server logs. If unspecified, defaults to <code>Banned by an operator.</code>
: {{arg desc|je=message}}

=== Result ===
{{Result table|onlyje=1}}
{{Result table|The command is incomplete, or any argument is not specified correctly.|unparseable}}
{{Result table|<code>targets</code> is not a valid IP, nor a name of an online player.|fail}}
{{Result table|Does not add any new IP address to blacklist.}}
{{Result table|succeed}}
{{Result table}}

=== Output ===
{{Output table}}
{{Output table|edition=je|On fail|N/A|0|0}}
{{Output table|On success|N/A|1|the number of online players that connecting with the specified IP}}
{{Output table}}

== banip ==
{{Outdated feature|section=1|edition=java}}
{{Infobox command
|name=banip
}}

Bans a player by IP number. Cannot be undone in-game; {{cd|banned-ip.txt}} must manually be changed.

The Classic equivalent of {{cmd|ban-ip}}.

=== Syntax ===
: <code>banip (<address>|<name>) [<reason>]</code>
